name: Multi Signature Consent
description: This module allows you to combine data from one or more forms into a single PDF.  It was designed for use in projects where you have multiple consent forms completed by multiple participants or coordinators and wish to merge them into a single, 'final', consent.  You can then use an Alert and Notification to email the final consent to participants.

project-settings.name:
Instructions
This module allows you to merge mulitple PDFs together. The source PDFs can come from REDCap surveys in this project or from pdfs uploaded to descriptive fields in the surveys being merged.

sub_settings.name:
Form
Select any form (data entry or survey) to be converted to PDF and merged

Include Metadata PDFs
If you attach a PDF to the form's metadata (via the descriptive file-upload field type) you can choose to include this PDF as part of the merge. This is commonly used for attaching IRB-approved consent PDFs to a survey. Only visible fields with PDF files will be included.

Include User Uploaded PDFs
If your form contains file-upload fields and a PDF was uploaded by the user, do you wish to include this PDF in the merged output. This is commonly used for participant uploading of signed paper documents.

project-settings.name:
File Field
This is where the PDF will be saved in the record and it must be a file-upload field

Update Logic
When this logic is true and one of the above forms is saved, then create the PDF. This logic should not be true until all forms are complete. Important: This logic should not remain true after the PDF has been generated or else it might lead to multiple PDFs being created on each subsequent SAVE event. Therefore, include logic that also stops generation if it has already occurred.
e.g. [coordinator_signature]<>"" AND [dest_file_field]=""

Custom Header
This header will appear in the upper-right corner of the PDF

Custom Footer
This footer will appear on the bottom center of the PDF

Keep Page Breaks
Normally page breaks between forms are removed. Check here to keep each form on a separate page in the PDF

Keep Record ID Field Row
The record id is always in the header, but if you check this it will also be part of the PDF if on the first instrument

Save in File Repository
Check to save a permanent copy in the local file repository

Save to External Storage
Check to save a permanent copy in the external storage (the same location that is configured for the econsent module)

Save As This Survey In File Repository
If you check the previous option, set which survey you want this to appear as in the File Repository. If you are using the eConsent Framework on one of the surveys in this config, then be sure to select a different survey as you can only have one entry per record, per survey id in the File Repository. Will default to first form otherwise

Save Only Completed Forms
If checked, only forms that were completed (status=2) will be added to the merged PDF

Enable Debug Logging
(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger

system-settings.name: Enable Debug Logging (system-wide)(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger
